channel.title: Chemistry help
channel.description:
Hey mates,
I have a question for all you scientists. Well, those who know chemistry. This is a question on a lab worksheet, and I don't know how to solve it. So if you can solve it, please do. You can make a picket fence to solve it.
Picket fence example
[img]http://img300.imageshack.us/img300/4171/untitledwy4.png[/img] = ? grams of sugar
Question: How many grams of sugar would you need to have the same number of particles as 5.0g of salt? Show your work.
Thanks, Leader

item.description:
@frank wrote:

divide by the molar mass of salt

Read full topic

item.title: Chemistry help
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

How do I find out what the number of particles is in 5g of salt?

Read full topic

item.title: Chemistry help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

1 mole is 1 x whateverthehelltheconstantvalueis particles

get the number of particals in 5g of salt, then multiply that by the molar mass of sugar

Read full topic
